00043 
00044 // Defining our own min/max macros seems to be the only sane way to get this
00045 // functionality across platforms thanks to some screwup in the MS header files.
00046 #define EQ_MAX(a,b) ((a)>(b)?(a):(b)) //!< returns the maximum of two values
00047 #define EQ_MIN(a,b) ((a)<(b)?(a):(b)) //!< returns the minimum of two values
00048 
00049 #include <cmath>
00050 #include <cstdio>
00051 #include <cstdlib>
00052 
00053 #ifndef _MSC_VER
00054 #  include <stdint.h>
00055 #  include <sys/param.h>  // for MIN/MAX
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 #ifdef Darwin
00059 #  include <crt_externs.h>
00060 #  define environ (*_NSGetEnviron())
00061 #elif !defined(_WIN32)
00062 extern "C" char **environ;
00063 #endif
00064 
00065 #include <co/base/types.h>
00066 #include <co/base/compiler.h>

00070 #define EQ_UNDEFINED_UINT32   (0xffffffffu)
00071 
00072 #define EQ_MAX_UINT32         (0xfffffff0u)
